recipe.title: How to Make Tonkatsu
recipe.intro: Tonkatsu is a Japanese fried pork cutlet. It is crispy outside and juicy inside.
recipe.ingredients: pork loin, salt, pepper, flour, egg, panko breadcrumbs, cooking oil, cabbage, tonkatsu sauce
steps: **Hit** the pork lightly with your hand to make it flat.
**Put** salt and pepper on both sides of the pork.
**Cover** the pork with flour, then egg, then panko.
**Heat** oil in a deep pan to 170 degrees.
**Fry** the pork for 4 minutes on each side until golden.
**Cut** the tonkatsu into pieces and serve with cabbage. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I found Mimosa Garden Dining on a quiet street in Newtown. There was a lovely garden patio with yellow mimosa flowers. I sat outside under a big tree. The air was fresh and nice. I ordered the tonkatsu set. The pork was very crispy and hot. The cabbage was fresh and green. The sauce was sweet and rich. The staff were friendly and kind. I loved this place very much.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Hello! Welcome to our restaurant. Here is the menu.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Thank you. What do you recommend?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Our tonkatsu is very popular today.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Oh, I love tonkatsu! What comes with it?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: It comes with rice, cabbage, and miso soup.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: That sounds great. I will have the tonkatsu set, please.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Sure. Would you like something to drink?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes, can I have green tea, please?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: OK. Your food will be ready in 10 minutes.
